column4: hey guys... anyone here with a IXP SB400 AC'97 Audio Controller
i don't have one but what's the problem you are having
my mic is not working properly
I try cranking up the mic voule and the sound becomes garbled
this little glitch is no very common
anything that could be causeing noise like a power cable near the mic cable
not quite... it is a head set.. brand new,,
could it be the sound capture device?
there are many options if I click the drop down box
i'd rather start with the simple options.
well... I shall fiddle and see
what's in the box right now?
what's in the box right now?
is the mic jack in the mic port and not the line in?
it is pretty hard to miss it ... it is a laptop ;)
is the headset wireless or wired
describe again what happens if you turn the sound all the way up
well ... the audio of any song or movie becomes garbled .. with lot's of static... and
it doesn't get any input from the mic
i'm guessing there is something wrong with alsa
bough it brand new... it is a headset
I tested it on a stereo and it works
the computer won't capture any sound from the mic
I would say... Not "el cheapo" brand but... it is a nice set
is the problem that the mic doesn't work or that it works but not so well
do you get sound from the mic at all
if the mic muted? (in the volume control)
well if I mute it no sound comes on...
all sounds are ok.. still no mic input
you have volume control open and not the icon on the top bar
in volume control click "edit" in the menu of the volume control window, and click on "Preferences"
you told me <Ashfire908> effie_jayx, edit -> preferences  then <Ashfire908> effie_jayx, select everything... where .. in sound?
in volume control click "edit" in the menu of the volume control window, and click on "Preferences"
select all the options by putting a checkmark in the boxes
headphone, PCM , Line in (muted) , CD, mic (muted) if I unmute it static.., IEC958, PC speaker
turn the mic volume all the way down, unplug the mic jack from the mic port, and unmute the mic
what options are there in the switchs tab?
line in, cd capture, mic capture (ticked), Mic boost (+20dB), video, Phoen. IEC958, Aux, Mix , Mix mono
sorry... I have.. this in options
line in, cd capture, mic capture (ticked), Mic boost (+20dB), video, Phoen. IEC958, Aux, Mix , Mix mono
sorry, i don't think i can help you. i'm really tired and i'm beingging to think your sound card might not work with ubuntu. search the fourms to see if it is supported by ubuntu
I will try to fix it... ;)... thanks for all
